title: Usage Examples
text: addition Google queries {r4googleads} comes built-support GoogleAds services listing accessible customers. Please notice examples assume working GoogleAds setup (MCC, Client ID, Client Secret, Developer Token client token) ’re authenticated successfully using {r4googleads}.

title: Usage Examples
text: First create corresponding R object class GoogleAdsFields set parameters send Google. Pass newly created object standard query_google_ads function received desired answer based parameters class object.
code: report_schema = googleAdsFields(   tbl = "campaign", # e.g. campaign report   api_version = 'v9'   ) campaign_report_schema <- query_google_ads(   mcc_id = '***-***-****', # Google Ads My Client Center ID   google_auth = google_auth,   service = report_schema,   raw_data = F ) > str(campaign_report_schema) List of 13  $ resourceName      : chr "googleAdsFields/campaign"  $ category          : chr "RESOURCE"  $ dataType          : chr "MESSAGE"  $ name              : chr "campaign"  $ selectable        : logi FALSE  $ filterable        : logi FALSE  $ sortable          : logi FALSE  $ selectableWith    : chr [1:194] "accessible_bidding_strategy" "bidding_strategy" "campaign_budget" "customer" ...  $ attributeResources: chr [1:4] "accessible_bidding_strategy" "bidding_strategy" "campaign_budget" "customer"  $ metrics           : chr [1:84] "metrics.absolute_top_impression_percentage" "metrics.active_view_cpm" "metrics.active_view_ctr" "metrics.active_view_impressions" ...  $ segments          : chr [1:24] "segments.ad_destination_type" "segments.ad_network_type" "segments.click_type" "segments.conversion_action" ...  $ typeUrl           : chr "com.google.ads.googleads.v9.resources.Campaign"  $ isRepeated        : logi FALSE

title: Usage Examples
text: Listing available accounts works similar fashion. … customers simple list resources.
code: list_customer_service <- listAccessibleCustomers(api_version = 'v9')  customers <- query_google_ads(   mcc_id = '***-***-****', # Google Ads My Client Center ID   google_auth = google_auth,   service = list_customer_service,   raw_data = F ) > customers $resourceNames [1] "customers/8880XXXXX"

title: Developer Guide
text: {r4googleads} designed forking, tweaking community contribution mind. Hence guide support users understand architecture, adapt {r4googleads} needs, extend package eventually contribute. basically cover three aspects guide: authentication, S3 Object Orientation Approach contribution pull requests feature based branches.

title: Developer Guide
text: order run queries, need Client ID, Client Secret, developer token client token Google. authenticate() functions walks Google’s OAUTH process stores client token hidden .RData file. Subsequent queries use client token hidden .google.auth.RData file exists. Otherwise authenticate() invokes dialog Google.

what: Object Orientation (OO) - Add New Google Services with Ease!
title: Developer Guide
text: S3 Object Orientation R specific implementation object orientation (OO). S3 far less strict concept languages, reasonable, light weight choice {r4googleads} use object orientation dispatch methods. {r4googleads} uses three S3 classes represent Google Services R: googleAdsSearch, googleAdsFields listAccessibleCustomers. Objects one classes can passed one single query function , .e., query_google_ads(). Internally, function uses S3 generic build_handle class specific methods build query specific curl handles implementing light form polymorphism avoiding potentially thick forrest -clauses. implementation keeps code transparent easy read effort facilitate adding Google Services future. {r4googleads} makes use REST interface Google Ads API. REST resource / service Google Ads API construct S3 Class R/google_services_construtors.R. modular approach enables extension {r4googleads} service service.

title: Developer Guide

Also, case specific feature developer longer development cycle others, can simply merge main branch might gotten new features meantime, feature branch time time. direct access original {r4googleads} repository, simply fork repository GitHub account work feature. ’re done tested new feature thoroughly issue pull request (aka merge request) merge new feature {r4googleads} dev branch. Please patient acceptance main branch branch deployed CRAN. Hence want take extra care review thoroughly introducing potential breaking changes.

what: Migrating your R Code from the Adwords API towards the new Google Ads API with {r4googleads}
title: RAdwords Migration Guide
text: last couple years Google developed new API Google Ads services. 27th April 2022, Google shut current Adwords API. end April R code relying {RAdwords} package deprecated. order keep code data tasks running, need refactor R code compatible new Google Ads API. created new R package {r4googleads} replace {RAdwords} package. {r4googleads} provides full functionality {RAdwords} plus additional new features! Start migrating code now easy step--step guide!

title: RAdwords Migration Guide
text: install latest stable version {r4googleads} R’s official Comprehensive R Archive Network (CRAN) run install latest development release GitHub using {remotes} R package. (example code assumes {remotes} package installed previously.)

title: RAdwords Migration Guide
text: authentication process {RAdwords} {r4googleads} remains (beside function name). means can just start using {r4googleads} package existing {RAdwords} authentication objects (tokens). good news don´t run whole authentication process can just start working code migration! previous {RAdwords} authentication: {r4googleads} authentication now :

title: RAdwords Migration Guide
text: {r4googleads} enables apply Google Ads Query Language directly. means can write SQL like syntax use Query Builder provided Google. previous {RAdwords} code: Loading data {r4googleads}: provide couple Google Ads SQL samples can load explore following function commands:default_search(), campaign_sample(), adgroup_sample(), adgroup_sample_1(), hotel_ads_sample(), keyword_sample(), , keyword_sample_1(), keyword_sample_2()
code: body <- statement(select = c('CampaignName', 'Clicks', 'Cost'),                   report = "CAMPAIGN_PERFORMANCE_REPORT",                   start = "2022-01-01",                   end = "2022-01-10")                    data <- getData(clientCustomerId = 'XXX-XXX-XXXX', #use Adwords Account Id (MCC Id will not work)                 google_auth = google_auth,                 statement = body) sql_query <- "SELECT campaign.name, metrics.clicks, metrics.cost_micros               FROM campaign               WHERE segments.date BETWEEN '2022-01-01' AND '2022-01-10'               AND metrics.impressions > 0               PARAMETERS include_drafts=true"  query_service <- googleAdsSearch(   aid = 'XXX-XXX-XXXX', # Google Ads Accountr ID   query = sql_query,   api_version = 'v9' )  data <- query_google_ads(   mcc_id = 'XXX-XXX-XXX', # Google Ads My Client Center ID   google_auth = google_auth,   service = query_service,   raw_data = F )

title: RAdwords Migration Guide
text: {RAdwords} explore report types Adwords API reports() metrics() methods. {r4googleads} can explore available Google Ads API reports :
code: tbl_schema_service = googleAdsFields(tbl = "campaign", api_version = 'v9')  tbl_schema <- query_google_ads(   mcc_id = 'XXX-XXX-XXXX',   google_auth = tbl_schema_service,   service = my_service_2,   raw_data = F )

title: Google Ads API Interface
text: Welcome official documentation R {r4googleads} software package! {r4googleads} enables users R Project Statistical Computing smoothly access Google Ads account load analyze information provided Google Ads API. Ads API Google’s latest application programming interface (API) Ads platform next generation AdWords API. Ads API enables Google Ads customers interact Google’s advertising platform using programming language. {r4googleads} helps implement advertising performance analytics R increase efficiency, make reports reproducible flexible enough managing even large, complex Google Ads accounts campaigns.

what: Developed by the Creators of RAdwords
title: Google Ads API Interface
text: {r4googleads} leading R client library Google Ads API developed Matthias Bannert Johannes Burkhardt. Since 2014, duo developed maintained RAdwords, #1 R client library Google’s predecessor Adwords API. ’s 66K+ downloads , importantly, 7 years experience reliable maintenance open source package. Let’s move new {r4googleads} ! (check migration guide!)

title: Google Ads API Interface
text: Connect Google Ads reports R Language Statistical Computing. Unlock next level campaign marketing performance analytics -> Learn analyze Google Ads statistics Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) using license cost freeeee open source programming language. Automate reports accounts, campaigns, adgroups keywords data reliably. authenticate Google Ads API light dependencies R packages stable long term production List top-level Google Ads accounts query Google Ads API reports Google Ads Query Language Load statistics, metrics KPIs Google Ads API including account, campaign, adgroup keyword data Load data schema Google Ads API reports including resource metadata, resource fields, segments metrics

title: Google Ads API Interface
text: guide assumes set working Google Ads API Developer Token Google Cloud Project. starting scratch trouble wrapping head around Google’s complex portfolio, stay tuned ultimate guide dropping Spring 2022 !

title: Google Ads API Interface
text: Install latest stable version {r4googleads} R’s official Comprehensive R Archive Network (CRAN) install latest development release GitHub using {remotes} R package. (example code assumes {remotes} package installed.)

title: Google Ads API Interface
text: Ok, {r4googleads} installed, stage set (Google accounts set dev tokens available, ) air clear, start authenticate Google’s servers. start interactive 1-2-3 process: Spin default web browser display Google’s login form login using credentials receive token ’s kept session (google_auth variable) stored .RData file congrats, ready load data R session!

title: Google Ads API Interface
text: specify data data want load R session can use Google’s SQL reminiscant query language. Visit link find available reports validate queries online. next step create service object contains query string, Google Ads Account ID API version want use. example uses one 3 constructors create different service objects: googleAdsSearch, googleAdsFields, listAccessibleCustomers. resulting service query object can passed query_google_ads functions sends service object Google’s actual API service. Note, MCC ID needed . handler inside query_google_ads processes service object depending class starts corresponding request. object d data.frame contains Google Ads statistics:
code: g_query <- "SELECT                 campaign.name,                  campaign.status,                 segments.device,                  metrics.impressions,                 metrics.clicks,                  metrics.ctr,                 metrics.average_cpc,                  metrics.cost_micros               FROM campaign               WHERE segments.date DURING LAST_30_DAYS               AND metrics.impressions > 0               PARAMETERS include_drafts=true" query_service <- googleAdsSearch(   aid = '***-****-***', # Google Ads Account ID   query = g_query,   api_version = 'v9'   ) d <- query_google_ads(   mcc_id = '***-***-****', # Google Ads My Client Center ID   google_auth = google_auth,   service = query_service,   raw_data = F )

what: Invoke the Authentication Process with Google — authenticate
title: Invoke the Authentication Process with Google — authenticate
text: function starts authentication process Google. Note function needs user interaction.

title: Invoke the Authentication Process with Google — authenticate
Invoke the Authentication Process with Google — authenticate
text: save logical, authentication information saved disk? Defaults TRUE.

title: Invoke the Authentication Process with Google — authenticate
text: data.frame containing credentials, optionally saved .RData current working directory

title: Prepare Curl Request — build_handle
text: Create

title: Prepare Curl Request — build_handle
text: x object class googleAdsSearch, googleAdsFields listAccessibleCustomers

title: Authentication of R app — .get_credentials
text: get_credentials authenticates R app Google authentication server using OAUTH2 receives client token. Usually need run get_credentials() explicitly since whole authentication process managed authenticate.

title: Authentication of R app — .get_credentials
text: Client token Google authentication server.

title: Loading the Access Token — .load_token
text: load_token loads access token using credentials provided another internal function (dot-get_credentials). Execution function possible per authentication process. Usually need run load_token() explicitly since whole authentication process managed authenticate.

title: Loading the Access Token — .load_token
text: credlist list credentials

title: Loading the Access Token — .load_token
text: Access token corresponding time stamp.

title: Refresh Access Token — .refresh_token
text: refresh_token returns new valid access token. access token deprecates one hour updated refresh token. Usually need run refresh_token() explicitly since whole authentication process managed authenticate.

title: Refresh Access Token — .refresh_token
text: google_auth list credentials access token

title: Refresh Access Token — .refresh_token
text: New access token corresponding time stamp.

title: Construct googleAdsFields Class (S3) — googleAdsFields
text: Create instance googleAdsFields class. list Google's ads services arguments can found : https://developers.google.com/google-ads/api/rest/reference/rest/v9/googleAdsFields.

title: Construct googleAdsFields Class (S3) — googleAdsFields
text: tbl character table argument api_version Google Ads API version e.g 'v9'

title: Construct googleAdsSearch Class (S3) — googleAdsSearch
text: Create instance googleAdsSearch class. list Google's ads services can found : https://developers.google.com/google-ads/api/rest/reference/rest.

title: Construct googleAdsSearch Class (S3) — googleAdsSearch
text: aid character Google account id query character query string function returns character query string. See also queries. api_version Google Ads API version e.g 'v9'

text: Create instance listAccessibleCustomers class. https://developers.google.com/google-ads/api/rest/reference/rest/v9/customers/listAccessibleCustomers.

title: Construct listAccessibleCustomers Class (S3) — listAccessibleCustomers
text: api_version Google Ads API version e.g 'v9'
